name: Epidemic Threshold Validation
description: Validate that SPKMC simulations match the theoretical epidemic threshold for SIR models on networks. For homogeneous networks (ER, RRN), theory predicts the critical transmission rate lambda_c/mu = 1/<k>. For scale-free networks with exponent gamma <= 3, the threshold approaches zero. We test this by varying lambda across the theoretical threshold and measuring the final outbreak size (attack rate).
hypothesis: The simulation should exhibit a phase transition in the final outbreak size at the theoretically predicted epidemic threshold. Below threshold: small outbreaks (~initial infection). Above threshold: large epidemics with attack rate scaling as (R0-1).
author: SPKMC Research

theoretical_notes.critical_exponent: Attack rate ~ (R0 - 1)^beta near threshold, beta = 1 for mean-field

analysis_plan.definition: R(t_end) = final fraction recovered, represents total fraction of population that was infected
expected_results: Group A (RRN k=10): Sharp transition at lambda_c = 0.10
Group B (ER k=10): Similar transition at lambda_c ~ 0.10, possibly slightly smeared due to degree variance
Group C (SF gamma=2.5): No clear threshold - epidemic even at very low lambda due to hubs
Group D (SF gamma=3.5): Lower threshold than ER, but finite threshold exists
Group E (Finite-size): Transition sharpens as N increases
Group F (Different degrees): Threshold scales as 1/<k> for different k values
plots_to_generate: Attack rate vs lambda for each network type
Attack rate vs R0 (normalized, all networks on same plot)
Comparison of threshold location across network types
